com.gmarciani.gmparser.models.automaton.state

Class State<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gmarciani.gmparser.models.automaton.state.State<V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<State<V>>

    public class State<V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<State<V>>

    The automaton state model.

    A state is identified by a unique id, and contains a collection of values. A state can be marked as final, initial or none.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Giacomo Marciani
    See Also:
    FiniteAutomaton, TransitionGraph, States

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      State(java.lang.Integer id)
      Creates a new state with the specified state id and empty value.
      State(java.lang.Integer id, java.util.Collection<V> values)
      Creates a new state with the specified state id and collection of values.
      State(java.lang.Integer id, V value)
      Creates a new state with the specified state id and value.
